New Records: Messi set a Copa América record with his 35th appearance and 18th assist
Key Match Events: Messi created two goals with his through ball and assist
Argentina scored two goals with Julián Álvarez and Lautaro Martínez
Canada struggled to contain Messi's plays
Pre-Game Insights: Argentina started with a strong lineup including World Cup winners
Jesse Marsch emphasized containing Messi's impact
Post-Match Reflections: Jesse Marsch praised the team's effort but acknowledged Messi's brilliance
Alphonso Davies expressed frustration with the second-half performance
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was held at a sold-out Mercedes-Benz Stadium
Grass was installed after an MLS game
Canada made their Copa América debut
